ibis.ipl
Interface SendPortDisconnectUpcall

public interface SendPortDisconnectUpcall

Disconnect upcall interface for sendports. An Ibis implementation may choose to block while processing this upcall.

Method Summary
 void lostConnection(SendPort origin, ReceivePortIdentifier receiver, Throwable cause)
          Upcall that indicates that a connection to a receiveport was lost.
 

Method Detail

lostConnection

void lostConnection(SendPort origin,
                    ReceivePortIdentifier receiver,
                    Throwable cause)
Upcall that indicates that a connection to a receiveport was lost. If a SendPort has been configured with connection upcalls, an upcall is generated for each connection that is lost. A receiveport can forcibly close the connection, in which case any communication from the sendport will cause a lostConnection upcall. The user may not assume that the mere fact that a receive port forcibly closes its connections causes a lostConnection call on the send port side. The send port has to do communication to detect that there is trouble.

This upcall may run completely asynchronously, but only at most one is alive at any time.

Parameters:
origin - the SendPort losing a connection.
receiver - identifier for the ReceivePort to which the connection is lost.
cause - the reason for this upcall.
